quote_a: I was impressed with the follow-up questions. It really seemed like it was able to understand my responses and then have a pretty good follow-up question to those responses.
quote_b: I think it could ultimately be soul-sucking in the long term as it becomes more and more prevalent.
explanation: The participant expresses genuine admiration for the AI interview experience yet simultaneously describes AI interaction as soul-sucking, revealing opposing sentiments on the same topic of AI-mediated conversation.

quote_a: I use AI for search pretty much daily, looking up different questions around recipes or really anything that comes up that I'm curious about, like random facts, health-related topics, ingredients, and food.
quote_b: if I have a very specific question, like, "Is rice healthier when it's refrigerated?" I might get mixed answers or it will show different articles that have different opinions. Sometimes, it doesn't always make the answer clear, and it can even provide a wrong answer citing an incorrect source.
explanation: The participant commits to daily AI search as their primary lookup tool but then reveals the tool frequently gives mixed, unclear, or outright wrong answers â€” a gap between stated reliance and described reliability.
